intro: Gomphostemma keralense, commonly known as Keralan gomphostemma, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and distinctive leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds. Gomphostemma keralense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
